Reviews.Title: “Good location, but avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: bigmak79
Reviews.Content: Very small room. No lock on bathroom door (basically like a closet). Newly remodeled room which looked nice at first, but it feels very cramped. The problem with not being carpeted is that dirt is easily tracked in and our feet were black from walking on the floor. WI-FI costs $2.99/night and was unreliable. It did not work most of the time and when it did, it was very slow. If I was traveling alone or not planning to spend any time in the motel, it may have been more tolerable. I would not recommend this motel for anyone traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler with Dog”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithDog
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in the West Wing. Pay the extra for a renovated room. No access or exit for your car or dog. No area with grass to walk the dog. You have to walk all the way to the front, turn right and walk out, and then walk back to right across the street where you can not get because of a fence to walk the dog in a nice grassy area. Forget Hooter next door. Go to BJs across the corner and have a super grill affair and nice waitresses. This Motel 6 needs to upgrade the West wing........ still, ask for the senior citizen rate and you will stay for about 434 total.

Reviews.Title: “nice!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTimon
Reviews.Content: updated motel 6 in Las Vegas! paid only 39 dollhairs for this motel, 5 minute walk to MGM Grand. Not far from the strip but still not in the centre either. We were very happy with everything but prefer to stay on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Liseehw
Reviews.Content: We got in late and very tired. I checked to make sure there there was nothing under the bed,removed to bedspread and went to sleep. We should have known there was something wrong when we had to drive around the American to another set of buildings circled by a chain link fence.. These were definitely not the renovated rooms some people talk about. I have felt softer horse blankets, and they didn't have burn holes. The tub was disgusting! There was a combination of grease and mold embedded in the tub surround seams. The sink wouldn't drain, and crude that was in the pipe floated up into the sink when we turned on the water. The motel caters to a wide variety of clientele .... The ones around us were extremely noisy and minimally dressed.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location but not a good motel”
Reviews.Author: martin_ebdon
Reviews.Content: Sadly the only poor motel on our two week road trip – Upside, It’s ideally located at the bottom end of the strip so you can walk to the bright light really easily. Downside, we had two rooms, ours smelt of cigarette smoke and my daughters smelt of dogs, both rooms the bedding had numerous holes burnt in it thanks to smokers. So why did we stay? I’d already had enough of Las Vegas traffic finding the place and I wasn’t sure I’d find anything better if we moved on. Sat nav location N36 06.025 W115 09.859

Reviews.Title: “Better vfm than the Las Vegas Hilton !”
Reviews.Author: LindsaySmith16
Reviews.Content: This very central accomodation is superb value for money, clean and with good amenities. Has swimming pool, grocery shop onsite and friendly staff. Tour desk has access to book all sorts of events. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: juanita a
Reviews.Content: i guess it was a bad night,but i could not get any sleep.The security guard was having problems with some of the guest,this was rather noisy.The internet service should be free to guests not an extra charge.the room was nice enough and clean.Oh last thing dont use the vending machine,your better off sticking it in a slot machine there yiu have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated room but some not so pleasant guests”
Reviews.Author: shazam10
Reviews.Content: This is one of the remodelled Motel 6's and I found it nice. It was clean, the floors were fine and the beds were as expected of Motel 6. The shower head is the same as every other Motel 6 I have stayed at. I did feel somewhat safe with the security guards around. It is convenient having a mini mart on location although I didn't actually visit it. Location wise its reasonably handy to the strip but even if you can't be bothered walking if you drove you can easily park in any of the casinos. The negatives. As expected Motel 6's tend to get guests who arn't as "pleasant". In this case for the two nights I stayed some crazy woman was screaming out abuse so was woken up on both occasions. She was pretty loud and I expected security to be swift with doing something about it but no that did not happen. Also, the airport noise was audible, so its not good for light sleepers. Overall, I gave it an average rating but I say its slightly better then that. It would have been very good if security did a better job of controlling the noise of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Goldy40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 17 days in a remodelled room which was cleaned everyday , the pool was handy and clean , the shower adequate ,tv was modern flatscreen with an ok channel selection and i didn't see any bugs My only complaint would be the 2.99 per day Internet is to slow Apart from that good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Worst motel 6 stay ever”
Reviews.Author: sarajonevada
Reviews.Content: I stay in many hotels. Most of time Motel 6. I had asked for a quiet room. I disliked my room as soon as I checked in. It stunk, was old looking & I knew it was not going to be quiet. I had drove all day from Reno to Vegas. Had a bad headache, stomachache & extremely tired. I used the bathroom & then called front desk to see if I could switch to another room. I had not brought any of my luggage in & the room was still clean. Front desk said no I could not switch because I had used the bathroom. They could easily have looked @ room to see that it was still clean. All night long, my upstairs neighbour walked across the floor. Very noisy. I complained to front desk but they Hung up phone on me & did nothing. I do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “very poor for the price... but this is Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_OShea
Reviews.Content: Quite poor Motel, our non smoking room smelled smoke from a mile away, cleanliness was sub average, no breakfast and the Internet no included. Yet... everything even remotely close to the strip comes at a price...

Reviews.Title: “Central location, nice pool, dirty room?”
Reviews.Author: TalbotTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this Motel 6, wanting somewhere central, with parking and a pool, and no casino. This ticked all those boxes - it is right across the road from the MGM Grand, and is an easy (if traffic-filled) walk to the Strip - less than 10 mins. Parking was plentiful and felt pretty secure with people around all the time. The pool was a real boon - large, sunny with shaded tables and sun loungers, and quiet with hardly anyone else using it. There was some traffic noise, but you get that everywhere in Vegas. The room was one of the recently remodelled ones, which basically means a lick of paint and new bedspreads. It looked clean, but our feet got filthy if we walked around barefoot, and then I saw a cockroach scuttle under one of the beds... The next day a dead one was on the bathroom floor. Not a sign of cleanliness. But - for an average of $60 per night - this was ok. Free coffee in the mornings and a small onsite shop for muffins and the like. Not the best but we'd probably stay again - just keep our shoes on!

Reviews.Title: “the world's biggest motel 6”
Reviews.Author: ed12_10
Reviews.Content: the first thing i saw when the cab drop me off was a security guard with a side arm strip to his hip....i was thinking to myself ( what did i get myself into) i book it for a week less then $30 a night check in was easy and fast ..room was small but newly remodel ...house keeping was great they let me sleep all day. only once they woke me up to ask if i needed any thing. i really like that because i'm a night person...play all night sleep during the day ...came a went all hours of the night never had a problem.(felt safe) coco 24hr restaurant next door, 24 hr store on site. over all great location, clean safe, cheap. just what i order...i'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Criminal Infestation makes travel risky for singles and families”
Reviews.Author: Victoriah_2000
Reviews.Content: It was a terrible experience. Things about my experience that I see in the reviews below: - THIS MOTEL HAS SERIOUS CRIMINAL POPULATION - THIS MOTEL WAKES YOU UP ON THE MORNING OF YOUR CHECKOUT STARTING AT VERY EARLY HOURS, MULTIPLE TIMES They kept sending the security up to my room to throw me out - right after i checked in (they assigned me to someone else's room) and then also when i was trying to check out )... it came to my attention that a serious criminal element has infested this hotel and so they are nervous that anyone could be involved. Perhaps some kind of drug ring or something? Although I'm not really sure but it was the strangest experience I've ever had a budget motel. Also, their wireless was broken. I will say that when the security came to my door on the final morning, they laughed when they saw me, saying that i did not look as dangerous as the front desk had described (WTF?). I was there for a wedding and I am a professional person, traveling alone. I was told that had i been spotted before hand, i would have been advised not to check in because its so dangerous there. Thank god the security was so nice, he even carried my bag to my car and admitted that they are not motel 6 employees. I cant imagine what would happen if you got a nut for a security guard who went psycho on you... seems like you'd have no recourse. This motel is not good location for families, middle aged couples or women traveling alone. I would also like to say that i was well aware of the redesign and had stayed here prior, which is why i booked a room here. the place has changed and people should take this seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Never had an issue”
Reviews.Author: PNSITH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for many nights and have never had an issue with service, cleanliness, security or safety. This hotel has all basic requirements and is convenient. The staff are so friendly they remember me when I re visit.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler with dog”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithDog
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the newly remodeled queen bed rooms. Very stylish and European, but am not a fan of the style. So close to MGM and the casinos on that end of the strip. Speedy check in and nice staff. Room was showing a little wear, but at the prices charged by the strip casinos, plus the additional deposit I would have needed for my little dog, this place was great. You can not go wrong with Motel 6 if you are on a budget or if you have a pet with you. The room had a huge on the wall flat screen tv that was great. If you have a light colored pet, paws will get very filthy walking around Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Good location but safety is an issue”
Reviews.Author: Jake T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to Hooters Hotel and Casino and a 5 minute walk to the MGM and the Vegas Strip. If you have limited funds and want to be close to the action then you go could worse. That said, when I stayed there at around 2am one night someone tried to enter my room. They kept trying to open the door and attempted to be trying to force their way in. It was quite a scary experience and really put me off the place. Eventually the person gave up and disappeared....

Reviews.Title: “stay at the roach motel”
Reviews.Author: lyn c
Reviews.Content: Booked in in at 8pm left at 10.30 pm. Roahes in both rooms, they smelt, the sheets were threadbare and stained, cigarette burns in the comforters (non smoking rooms), one shower had no water pressure, hair in the showers and beds and the carpets were frayed, need I say more? Asked for a refund which was promptly given. Have stayed here before but never again. Motel 6 is no longer good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “scary motel with once in a lifetime experience”
Reviews.Author: bass3t
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago. It was awful. The room smelled like hell, bugs were fighting with each other and so did the police with local criminals, hookers and other scum of the earth. We were so frightened that we put chairs against the door. I have never seen such motel in my entire life. If you hate yourself, stay here. If you love yourself and you're out of money, stay in your car.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BE LATE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laverys
Reviews.Content: After our car broke down, we decided to stay at this Motel 6. We had a remodeled room and it was nice. A nice flat screen TV and hard wood floors. The bed was so-so, the shower was super small, and there were crickets in the room. I had also noticed a couple of roaches as well. Anyway, after staying at this motel for 2 weeks, I was a little late paying for 1 more night and they kicked us out! I had not had any problems before. MANAGEMENT WAS RUDE AND HUNG UP THE PHONE ON US WHILE WE WERE TRYING TO TALK TO THEM!!!! The housekeepers speak very weak English, which can be a problem. Maintenance was rude as well! Do yourself a favor! Stay somewhere else. The 2.99/day internet is a joke. It hardly ever worked. My hotspot on my droid was 10 times better than their wi-fi! STAY AWAY!! STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skydog724
Reviews.Content: I can't complain at all about this hotel. Remember it's all what you make it. I was going to post some pics but the pics I have are no different from the ones that people already have posted on here. Check in was quick, and my room was ready when I checked in. The room was clean. I didn't like the matress but it was o.k. for a few days remember this is a budget hotel. They have a store right next to the hotel that's open 24 hours. There is a restaurant right next to the hotel that's open 24 hours also. It's a short walk to the strip and you are on the bus line. I actually caught the bus down to the Walmart to grab a few things that I needed for the trip. You don't have all the amenities of the Casino hotels but that's not why your staying here. Would I stay here again? Absolutely, this trip was not planned for me. I went to Vegas to get away from Hurricane Irene and this is where I ended up so it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly stay here!”
Reviews.Author: RCM M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two dogs stayed there this past weekend in one of their newly remodeled queen rooms. Not bad at all. The place was exactly like the pics show. Very modern and clean. We would definetly stay here again. The value couldnt be be either. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Di S
Reviews.Content: Really impressed by the location, quality and price. Sure it can be a bit noisy (but we were there at same time as Bikers' Convention!) but doubt anywhere in Vegas so near the Strip is quiet. Have already recommended......

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: ClaireUK87
Reviews.Content: Wonderful newly-renovated motel that is very close to The Strip. I was impressed by the lobby/reception area, which had computers for internet access, a seating area with TV and even a concierge desk. The room was modern with a plasma TV, however no fridge (although there was an ice bucket and an ice machine not too far away). As someone who feels more comfortable showering behind a locked door, my only complaint would be that the bathroom door wasn’t really a door, but more like a suggestion of what one should be. It was made up of two panels that didn’t quite meet in the middle and there was no handle or lock. In the end my friends and I devised a system so we’d know when the bathroom was occupied. On the whole though I liked the room, it was clean and comfortable and in a great location for exploring Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: LAG1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here at the this property. All in all I was surprised. The rooms were small but clean. We stayed in a new room. Was worth the price since we did not stay in our room much. Our stay was quiet. The pool was nice and clean. The store was useful.

Reviews.Title: “It was what it was...nice emergency stay back up”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: Hey all, So I was staying at Mandalay Bay (my fave in the summer) when a friend asked me to go to a show at the Cosmo with her. I'm a bit of a princess when it comes to LV hotels but Unfortunately, it was a Saturday and a big convention of about 30,000 came into town. Basically there was nothing in town under $300...My budget was about $50 since I was leaving for another casino in the morning ...(see my Pala review). I stayed at MBay all day (the $25 spa with a locker helped keep my valuables while I swam) and about 9pm I checked in to the M6 which is a surprisingly big property. They have a 24 hour liquor/snack store and check in was quick. I booked 2 queens so I could use the extra pillows and blankets.The only awkwardness was that they have a competing hotel in the middle of their property. I went to go check my room location out (later I realized I went to the wrong side of the building) and went about my evening fun....I returned around 3am crashed to sleep and woke up at 8:30 for my next adventure. The a/c made it super cold how I wanted. the bathroom was no frills. Sometimes with a M6 it is best to bring your own towels and pillows. The property is near cheap gas, Hooters and the MGM Grand is in walking distance. I was a female traveling alone and didn't have any safety issues. I think I would of felt more iffy if my room had been on the streetside.. My tab with tax was $50 since I booked online (including tax). If you have an emergency I'd use it again.. i know they have some upgraded rooms but I chose a regular one. If you don't plan on being in your room 90% or have an emergency it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good For Money Bad for Comfort”
Reviews.Author: SriLanka2010
Reviews.Content: I just happen to stay one night at Motel 6 Tropicana, Las Vegas as I could not find a reasonably priced room near Madalay Bay Convention Center. It was fisrt week of June 2011. The Hotel is centrally located for me as its only 10 min walk to my venue. The Lobby not cozy but staff at Check-in/out OK and professional. Room is typical; booked non-smorking one. But could not sleep whole night as the pillows smelled tobacco. Also did not feel much safe may be due to the type of people who were staying on that day. I had some good attitudes about Motel 6 but this experience ruined it. One good experience; someo If one need cheaper place its not a bad choice but does not seem fitting for families. In my case I will not go to this place again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value, great location, nice refurbished rooms!”
Reviews.Author: loobo
Reviews.Content: Booked on recommendation by TripAdvisor and was satisfied! We have chosen newly refurbished room, which are excellent, way above Motel 6 standard and makes you feel like almost in hotel. Very clean and overall nice. Big flat screen TV was nice surprise. LOCATION is just amazing, just few steps from strip and monorail station! If you don't fancy on hotel services and looking for a sleep in decent place go for it! Of course Vegas is busy 24/7 and you can get some disturbances during night if you are unlucky... Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, No Frills, No Problems”
Reviews.Author: Graygab1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights here because it's what my budget allowed since I traveled solo. Front desk staff were friendly. Because of the reviews on tripadvisor, I asked for a room close to the office. My room was in building 3, second level room 410 just past the swimming pool. Not far at all. The room was a standard motel room. No frills. Bed was okay, everything in working order and I felt safe. As with any motel, you can sometimes hear travelers coming and going all hours of the night, but it wasn't a problem for me. The MGM is literally across the street and there are safe crossing walks for you to get there. Takes about 5-10 minutes as the block is just a bit long. WiFi is provided on scratch off cards. You buy them at time of check in for the number of days you need. Connection speed is swift and I had no problems with leaving my laptop in the room while I ventured out each day. I placed a do not disturb sign in the door each day I left, but on 2 occasions, they still cleaned the room. Didn't really like that too much. Shower is good and hot. Heating/cooling unit worked well. If you need extra towels, blankets, pillows, iron, and ironing board, the front desk has them. Also, I'm so glad the 24 hour store is on site, as the room had no microwave or fridge. Takes 10 minutes to get to airport and costs $9-$10. The front desk will call a cab for you and they arrive within minutes to pick you up. Would stay again if I needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest and nicest Motel 6 I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: jay34144
Reviews.Content: Great place, cheap price, clean, modern room. I'd do it again. Wifi was not free.

Reviews.Title: “basic budjet hotel , clean cosy”
Reviews.Author: Horizon080
Reviews.Content: not excattly on strip . 15 min walk to MGM rooms are clean but small and wifi is not free have cafe near by but indian restra is very far beds are small but in that price overall good good if you get rooms in around 30 USD

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: Taberville
Reviews.Content: Frightening and loud profane argument next room. Police moving someone out in next building. Worse yet, I was stupid enough to give my Email address with a promise from them that it was for Motel 6 only. I had 97 SPAMs in next 24 hours and it continues to this day. Sure a lot of high heels marching up and down the upper deck and doors being open and closed all night. Guess that's just Vegas. I don't think so. If you have any respect for your family, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to locate, friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: CleoRodney
Reviews.Content: Love the fact that Motel 6 is pet friendly. We were in the process of moving, parking was good for the UHaul and we were also towing our vehicle. Stay was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: fotoastron
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the Motel 6,on Tropicana Avenue, which is literally next to the airport,and the fare was just $12, check in was super fast, and the staff very friendly. The room was very nice, cozy, very clean, and warm. No outside noise at all, even though the airport strip is 50 yards away. The location is great, just 300-400 yds. to the strip.(MGM,NEW YORK NEW YORK etc.) 7 nights and complimentary coffee every day, with the taxes was only $260,you can't go wrong. Sure beats the hotels prices of $550-1000, for the same nights, folks. It's very worth the stay. Idefinitely will be going back soon. with the diff. in price, your your food and drinks are maybe almos free........ Have a nice stay, what ever your choices are.

Reviews.Title: “Super Small!!!”
Reviews.Author: LINDAMILLER55
Reviews.Content: No tissues, hairdryers, coffee makers, alarm clocks,rooms are super small-almost closterphobic...1 ice maker for the whole complex..too l paper thin large for only one ice maker. No Vending machines for pop..would not stay again. Walls are paper thin, hear the upstairs guest all night long..would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “euro style rooms,clean and safe-management was fabulous-location,location,location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sungold-travel
Reviews.Content: The General manager was so accommodating with all my needs. Traveling with a group and pets it is always hard to find everything you want and need . I think this has to be the best value in Las Vegas over new years. We received a group rate. We were only a block off the strip!!!!! Lots of security and most of the staff was very helpful. The rooms have flat screen TV's and very modern furnishings and a beautiful pool area . All and all this was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE STAFF.....SAVE YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Jessyann68
Reviews.Content: I AM JUST GOING TO TELL IT LIKE IT IS: My husband & I were staying at this motel 6 for about a week. 1st off if you want to pay the extra money for one of there newly renovated rooms (not worth it, trust me) you will get a nice spot by the pool etc. etc. if you decided not to pay the money (the beds are more comfortable if you don't) they will put you in a room that is so far away you almost think you are on a different property. Literally, we walked through the renovated rooms, past a restaurant, past a convenient store, past another hotel and then finally got to our room. It was ridiculous. It was older.....found a roach, I told the front desk and was basically told "So What"......Here is the straw that broke the camels back........One morning before my husband & I decided to start our day.....we decided to "be with each other" (not to be crude) and without knocking at 930am house keeping whips the door open.....she sees us mid act and left the door open so the gentleman & his wife outside could see up too. I immediately went to the office and told her of the indecent. She told me that it was MY FAULT, I should have locked the deadbolt.......and then started to blame ME for housekeeping busting open my door (BEFORE CHECK OUT) then because of this she actually said that we were not allowed to stay at this hotel anymore because they do not condone acts like that at there establishment......I DIDN'T HIRE A HOOKER, I WAS MAKING LOVE WITH MY HUSBAND IN THE PRIVACY OF OUR OWN ROOM! I hate this hotel.......my recommendation.....if you want to have a good time in Las Vegas stay the hell away from this hotel..............everyone that works there is a complete moron (with the exception of maybe 2) ESPECIALLY THE MANAGERS.......WHICH I DID AND WILL CONTINUE TO REPORT TO THE MOTEL 6 CORPORATE OFFICE.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST MOTEL 6 IN THE UNITED STATES !!!”
Reviews.Author: BIGBERT305
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of a writer so I'll just list my reasons for rating this Motel 6 Tropicana as the worst in the United States... 1. Newly renovated rooms look great but I've slept on softer floors than the mattresses that are in those rooms honestly, NO JOKE ! 2. We get there with reservation in hand and all of a sudden there's a mistake on Motel 6's end and we had to pay $60+ dollars more because of some explanation that only a motel 6 employee would understand, I've made over 50+ reservations in other Motel 6's and NEVER had an issue with my reservation price i get to this motel 6 and i have a prob. 3. I honestly don't like people in my room when im not there, for the first three days i would call front desk and say "i would not like room service for my entire stay please do not disturb me". What do i get ? room service everyday ! Lack of communication with thier staff point blank, i especially like being woken up every day in the morning with a woman asking me do i want room service to sign the maids log at 8am. 4. First thing i see when i go into the room on my 1st day is a huge roach dead on the floor !? 5. Small 24 hour store has had so many thefts that when you walk in they literally follow you around the store as if your going to steal something ! 6. Area that this Motel 6 is in is a Dump and the lot next to it is abandoned and filed with porn advertisement and a million broken bottles. 7. Walls are paper thin and i mean just normal talking levels are too loud as you can tell everything that is being said in the next room. 8. GRAND FINALE.... I'm taking a shower and my wife gets a call from front desk that the water is leaking into the room downstairs below me and i need to stop taking a shower and get put another room immediately. Then they say in the morning is fine as long as we don't shower anymore, well next morning i call to switch rooms and they say "we don't know what your talking about" ! LMAO These were my experiences, take them as you will.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and it won't bust your budget.”
Reviews.Author: sunspotbaby62
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from las vegas today, we are very pleased with our week long stay at motel 6. The staff were nice and the room was great. Loved having a store on site and open all night. Close to the strip and right on the bus line which is very nice. The room was very clean and we didn't have any problems. Loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for Vegas Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Jetkay
Reviews.Content: Me and a few girlfriends went on a last min trip and booked here. We weren't on the strip but were very close by walking distance. Close to the MGM. There's also a food/alcohol store on site that is open 24hrs which is nice. The room wasn't very large but the bathroom and shower was a good size. Everything is nicely updated. Didn't have any problems and would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good value on a budget”
Reviews.Author: area51base
Reviews.Content: Whenever there is a convention in Las Vegas, I always book my stay at motel 6. Many hotels raise their prices during conventions, while Motel 6 always has their same low rates. Rooms are always clean and comfortable. I just booked my stay at Motel 6 for the 2011 CES Convention. The location is ideal since it's walking distance to the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Vegas Style”
Reviews.Author: Magrath
Reviews.Content: This was a recently renovated Motel 6 and well done with designer colors. The staff were very helpful and provided coupons with their personal opinions. Very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: peatmeister
Reviews.Content: My wife, our pet Pomeranian and myself have been staying at the Motel 6 Tropicana in Las Vegas about twice a year for the past ten years. This location just gets better and better. Their recently remodeled rooms were a welcome surprise on our last visit. Quiet, comfortable and pet friendly all for a fantastic nightly rate, just a five minute walk from the Vegas Strip. Always our first choice when heading to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Almost European”
Reviews.Author: Dave97210
Reviews.Content: The remodeled rooms are somewhat sparse and very modern - almost European in style. All nicely new and fresh with everything you need. This is a very large motel 6 close to the strip and very affordable. It is very close to the airport and convenient to the monorail across the street at the MGM. Small convenience store in the parking lot for snacks and anything you forgot. Great choice

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative for an easy stay”
Reviews.Author: defMunichCanyonRider
Reviews.Content: Ok, when going to Las Vegas, you should think about staying in one of the Casino-Hotels. But if you look for just a hotel, easy to get to, easy to park, easy to get to your room (no labyrinth aorund slot machines), that thsi Motel 6 is a good choice. Parking is near the rooms, the check in is fast. The location is good, it´s fast to get to the strip, but a little bit out of the hectic boulevard. I was staying in a renovated room. It is very nice, but sometimes a bit unpracticle 8e.g light at the table is limited when you want to read. The wifi cost extra (like usual at Motel 6), but the connection was a bit poor. Nevertheless, if you look for an easy way to stay, take a closer look. Only keep in mind, that it is very close to the airport, so you have noise of starting/landing planes in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but worth it .”
Reviews.Author: JamesBond0007
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews state, opp MGM & next to Hooters casino. Hey its a motel 6. All sparse rooms,very modern but basic. Thats what you get. Small pool area, dinner type place next door. Hooters 5mins away. No complaints about the place at all. $69 for a sat in vegas is good in my book. If you want the casino type , high roller feel of Vegas pay a little more & treat yourself. If you need a bed close to the action you are fine here. Bit of wasteland to walk past and maybe a little scary for older visitors or first timers to the USA. We would go back. Hooters looked fun if you are a party animal & MGM looked a nice place if you wish to treat yourselves at the bottom end of the strip. If not motel 6 is your place........

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain near strip”
Reviews.Author: leishirsute
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the newly renovated single rooms. They are small but everything was clean. Walking distance to MGM and strip requires just crossing the street. Internet access was $3/day but the rates are so cheap compared to internet at $15 for some of the luxury hotels. The staff was candid about comparing the renovated rooms to the standard nonrenovated rooms. They also suggested changing a 6 night stay to a 7 night stay to get a weekly rate which was a $40 savings over the 6 night stay. No continental breakfast but a 24 hour convenience store is in the parking area. I'd stay here again if I could get one of the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This place was a waste of time and money! (you get what you pay for)”
Reviews.Author: Starwalker82
Reviews.Content: Well, where do I begin? First off, we get to the hotel lobby from our 4 hour flight to find out they have lost our reservation (even though I called the day prior to reconfirm and brought my confirmation receipt with me) then they inform us that none of the rooms are ready. We ask if we can leave our luggage at the bell desk until a room is available. They tell us "NO" we don't have a bell desk, but provide lockers for guests to store luggage. So we proceed all the way around the back of the building to the locker area (carrying about 8 bags) and put our .50 cents into 4 lockers (because they are so small) and of course the lockers don't open. So as we are trying to get our money out of the locker, the police walk up to ask if we have a problem. (Ok, so now we are criminals) We finally get someone from the front desk to come and help us out. We return to the hotel around 4 hours later and finally are able to check in. So the clerk gives us our keys and says " just walk past the pool and it should be on your left" Simple enough right? WRONG!! What she failed to tell us is that this particular property is divided by another motel called America's Best Value Inn. Our room ends up being two parking lots away from the lobby. This may not have been so bad, however, we are carrying 8 large bags because there are no luggage carts. Ok, finally find the room and of course, the keys do not work. We find the first employee we see (the housekeeper who does not speak much english) and she says" front desk". By now I am really pissed because the front desk is 2 parking lots away!! So after all this we end up staying 1 night and leaving this hellhole. Trust me guys, in Vegas spend a little more at one of the places on the strip, it is well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: maptrotter62
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this motel on a recent trip through Vegas. Motel 6 has no frills, just a bed, bath and TV. If you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere. The room was small but clean and a great deal at 50.00 a couple on a Friday night. With that said, this motel is in a great location. Just off the strip and within walking distance to major places. Dump your car here and take off for lots of fun. The neighborhood is safe and the motel has a security guard walking the premises. The airport is close and there is noise associated with that but we were not in our room much and with the air conditioner running, were not too distracted. The motel is actually divided into two parts with another motel in the middle. Locating our room was a little confusing but didn't really cause any problems. Staff was professional, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Practically on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyandmarvin
Reviews.Content: This motel was just what myself and 3 fellow travellers needed. $40 each for 3 nights, this clean, well situated, friendly (but huge) motel was perfect. The staff were very friendly and more than happy to help when one of our suitcases did not fit in a lock up on our final day. The pool area is nice and clean. The bedrooms were large enough for 4 girls with large luggage and clean. There is heaps of car parking spaces. The onsite convenience store is open late (if not 24 hour, I can't quite remember). The location is absolutely fantastic, you can easily walk to the MGM, Excalibur, New York New York, Luxor, Monte Carlo, amongst many more. However, if you suffer from ill health and do not have a wheel chaire, do bare in mind that this motel is huge. It felt like our room was about a mile away from the road, and in 110degrees F that doesn't feel good, thankfully the air-conditioning unit in the room was fantastic. P.S. coco's (the breakfast place onsite) serves great food, however, we went all three mornings and the staff didn't manage to get any of our orders correct any on the times. If you have the patience it is worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: english44_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our way to the Grand Canyon. Not knowing too much about where to stay in Las Vegas I took the recommendation of a friend who said the Motel 6 chain was good value. I wasn't disappointed - to pay nearly $40 for a room for a family was super cheap compared to what we would have to pay in NZ! Our 2 teenage daughters were a bit disappointed that I hadn't booked a room on the Strip ( close to all the "action") but reading reviews of some of the hotels on the Strip on our return to NZ I was pretty happy that I had made the right decision. We saved the $15 a day Strip fee which was mentioned in reviews. We were able to park our car right outside our unit. Service at Reception was excellent - there were at least 3 staff on duty when we arrived to check -in. The unit was clean & comfortable. The main outside pool was lovely (there are 2 pools) - a nice setting & tidy surrounds. The only criticism I have is that the units don't have small fridges - Las Vegas would be one of the hottest places to stay in the US over the summer so I would have thought a fridge was mandatory! Trying to keep drinks cold for 4 people using one ice container was out of the question! The motel is only a 5 minute walk from MGM & Excalibur casinos so pretty close to the "hussle & bussle" of the Strip but without the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Hooker Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got there after a 22 hr drive and expected to get one of the newly renovated Queen rooms. It was renovated but they were full size. The air conditioner had 1" of clearence between it & the bed. A/C didn't work, was falling apart & they put us in a non smoking when we asked for smoking. We changed to a smoking room the next morning but it was a 1/4 mile walk to the back of the hotel. As we were moving into our new room, so was our new nieghbor...a hooker & everything she owned. At least she was kind enough to post a "WELCOME" sign outside her door so her customers wouldn't get lost. Between her fighting with her roommate right outside our door & the long winded 4am conversations 2 ft from my window with her pimp, I got no rest at all. When we checked out, there was another hooker & her pimp trying to check in but there was some confusion as to who actually owned the car they had to list on thier check-in sheet. Stay FAR AWAY from here!! Tiny showers even a "little person"would have difficulty with, missing light fixture covers & roaches. Save your $$$ and go elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “3 Months in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Vegasbaby14
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from en extended stay at Motel 6 and was quite happy with my stay there. A few good features include a very nice pool area, on site market, excellent inexpensive restaurant right next door (CoCos) and the location is excellent. The motel provides clean,updated rooms with 24 hour security guards. The only improvement I would recommend is for more comfortable mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “its only ok!”
Reviews.Author: alphbetga
Reviews.Content: well i am here to work so i was here only for a place to sleep but i went down to the little market to get change for the laundry and the lady told me with an attitude "well you have to buy something to get change" and i was like ah ok ,no thanks i just want to do laundry after all mostly everybody was nice to me but her and it really made me feel uncofortable when thats all i wanted scince im not from vegas.theres only like three chanels on tv and a really small shower i bet they have bigger showers in prison.if you are broke stay here if not you are not wasting your money stay at a convinient hotel or motel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: kiki369
Reviews.Content: its a very good cheap motel for staying in las vegas. no security deposit so you will have extra money to spend. it has small rooms but you only need the room to sleep in. there is so much to do in las vegas you wont want to stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel Anthony P
Reviews.Content: I had to attend an emergency meeting in las vegas on saturday and every hotel was sold out or ridiciously expensive so i decided on motel 6 tropicana next to the mgm grand and hooters. WOW stupid decision... If you like the smell of marijuana and smoke you will love this place. I was so grossed out by this place, I understand motel 6 is a value chain and your going to get a basic room with no frills...When I got there I went to check in and they lost my reservation for a newly renovated room, so they gave me an older room which was a smoking room. I accepted it because every other hotel was either sold out or about 350 a night (yes even the Excalibur and the Sahara). Upon walking to the room which what seems 2 miles away I was greeted by 2 men smoking some marijuana and making obscene gestures toward people walking by, finally at the room I walked in and the smell of smoke overcame you. I walked in and the beds had smoke holes all over the comforters, the TV didn’t work, the floor looked like it haven’t been vacuumed in months, wow the list goes on and on... STAY AWAY STAY AWAY!!!!! Never again will I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Room was Clean, Service was Great, Area did not feel secure”
Reviews.Author: Kansastraveller1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight while in between flights. This is a very big complex. My only complaint was that i had a long walk down a dark area that did not feel very secure. I did not have any problems, but i think they should have more lights or an escort on a golf cart or something. My walk from the office to my room was the equivalent of about two city blocks. Since i didn't have a car, it was a long walk. The upside was that the staff was good and helpful. The room was about what you'd expect for a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “A Rough Diamond”
Reviews.Author: LisaFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this motel, its opposite the massive MGM, and 5 minute walk to the strip. This place is a no frills, clean, friendly, unintimidating place. Travelling alone and a female, feeling safe is a must, I did here. Security walk round the premises all night. The pool is a good size, clean and pretty Supermarket on site, restaurant next door, good breakfast deals. Rooms, newly renovated, flat screen telly, modern, but basic decor. The airport is across the street too, well the start of it, taxi is more economical than a transfer. Staff very nice, maids didn't come round every day though. A visit to the outlet mall is a must. Tickets for the bus can be bought from lobby in MGM, 45 minute journey. I booked on internet, for 7 days, it cost me $150. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: CharlesS8
Reviews.Content: The place is better since they completed the renovations. if you want a inexspensive place to stay without all the frills, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for motel 6”
Reviews.Author: blackalls
Reviews.Content: stayed 1 night ...have stayed at this one before & found it good value for the money...this motel is massive...we got lost trying to find the room which was like 1032...not very far walking to the strip & safe walking back....thought we would have a lot noise with late night revellers arriving back, but never heard any noise

Reviews.Title: “Best Value In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bravo1950
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas 2 to 3 times per year,and have for over 10 years. This motel 6,on East Tropicana & Koval Lane is the best budget stay in town. The rooms have all been remodeled,they are clean and functional. The swimming pool is large and well maintained. security is excellent and it is only a short 5 minute walk to the strip. SWi Fi is $3 per day and trouble free. room prices are great,especially if you book it on the net. Based on price,location,and quality you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kc2005
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Las Vegas. This was our second time staying at the Motel 6 on Tropicana. The staff is wonderful. The room had updated furnishings (the flooring is vinyl instead of carpet - a great idea) and the room was very clean. The pool gets plenty of sunshine so it stays warm enought that you can still take a dip in the evening. It's a few blocks from the Strip, across the street from MGM Grand and its a short taxi ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: unci_paul
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a holiday in the USA and visited Las Vegas when I was there. The motel was within walking distance of the Strip, and the room that I was in looked lke it had been recently renovated and was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Rat-hole”
Reviews.Author: nivhana
Reviews.Content: I"ve stayed at numerous Motel 6 locations in Arizona, New Mexico and California and they have all been immaculately clean. This Motel 6 was so disgusting and so vile that I have vowed to never, ever stay in any Motel 6 locations in Nevada- it has been so traumatising. First of all, my friend and I checked in and it was close to midnight. The staff seemed nice and polite but when we checked into our room, it was a different story. While I looked around the room to make sure everything was nice, I went into the bathroom and found to my horror, pubic hair stuck onto the toilet seat. And yes, there was still urine in the toilet bowl! When I called to complain, the front desk lady said that she couldn't do aynthing but send in housekeeping to clean the room. At 12:00 midnight?? Yeah right, lady. I argued with her some more, letting her know that even if the bathroom was clean, who's to say that the rest of the room was clean too? Finally, she relented and let us change rooms. We had to go back to the front desk, ask for the other keys and finally we checked into our second room. The second room wasn't bad, it smelled like smokes but we chose a smoking section so it was fine with us. The second night though was horrible. We got locked out of our rooms, had to go back to the front desk and was told lies about my cell phone interfering with the key, thus not making it work. What a lie! First of all, my cell phone was no where near the key since I kept the key in my pocket and my cell in my handbag. While the guy was telling us that lie, the horrible lady (the girl that didn't want to change our rooms) was laughing at us but because this was around 5 in the morning, but I was so tired that I just didn't want to argue with her. We finally were able to check in our room and tried to sleep but the skeezy neighbors next to us were drinkin' and chatting and the walls are so thin, you could hear almost every word they were saying. The morning crew was the only good thing about this motel. They were so sweet and kind, especially the guy who got our room checked out. But Motel 6 needs to do something about their people working the graveyard shift. With the money you're spending and for almost the same price, you can get far nicer rooms at Luxor, Monte Carlo or TI.

Reviews.Title: “perfect motel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: forreal00
Reviews.Content: in reading the other reviews before my travels i was hesitant to stay here however, i was impressed. what can you say......great price, exterior corridor's so we did not have to take an elevator 15 floors to get to our room, the newly renovated rooms are great and the non-renovated rooms are great. if you are going to go to vegas and stay in your room the whole time then go to the wynn and pay over 100.00. if you are going to sleep in your room and need a bed and easy acces stay at motel 6. the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, the pool is great, they have a mini mart 24 hours a day so you don't have to drive somewhere for food or beverages or even gifts to take home to your friends. the prior reviews are obviusly people that stay in their room all the time instead of getting out and having fun in vegas. this is a party town so book here and you will have a great time and it's pet friendly. and also, it's wifi for 24 hours is only 2.99, the other casines are 14.99 and up per day

Reviews.Title: “No longer my favorite motel!”
Reviews.Author: Roni67
Reviews.Content: This was once my favorite motel. It is conveniently located just off the Strip but in walking distance of attractions. I requested a newly remodeled room with a queen bed. Bad choice! The design of this room is a DISASTER! There is a bi-fold door separating the bedroom from the vanity/toilet area. In order to use the bathroom, you close these bi-fold doors. Anyone needing to wash up or use the sink, needs to wait until you are through using the toilet before they can get to the vanity. I can't see myself staying here again unless they offer rooms that have not been remodeled or if I am staying here alone. Too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and nice rooms (but too small for 4 persons)”
Reviews.Author: Martino999
Reviews.Content: Overall, this Motel6 achieve a high rating - smart room, clean, friendly staff and next to the famous strip of Las Vegas. What do you want more? Only a little more space in the room for four persons (adults and teenagers and for big luggages!). Price-/service relation = top!

Reviews.Title: “Vile! Las Vegas version of Abu Graib”
Reviews.Author: Hawk999
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 3 am to find a stained room with sheets off the bed in the floor and one towel. Garbage was strewn all over. Tried to make it work because it was so late but the sink pipes poured water onto the floor when I tried to brush my teeth. Customer service said they knew "my type" because I tried to make it work and didn't come to them immediately. Avoid at all costs! You'll save money but sleep in a pig sty.

Reviews.Title: “Best Motel 6 I ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sliver2907
Reviews.Content: I booked this Motel 6 to stay at since I usually stay at a Motel 6 when I travel for pleasure. I dont expect too much, just a bed and a shower and TV. I was shocked at how nice this Motel 6 is, newly remodled. You just have to ask for one of the remodeled rooms, which they are rolling out across the system. I am a flight attendant and on business stay at high quality hotels, but this was pretty compareable to a Marriott, of course no coffe maker, iron etc, but I dont need that, just a nice room. The rooms have been made to look like European Hotels, with bright colors, flat screen tvs, granite coutner tops, a seating area, and the pool area was beutifully ladscaped. I got a pool view room, which was great. Again, be sure to ask for a remodeled room, since they are all not done yet. The service was friendly and I was very happpy with this stay. ! block, walkable from the strip and right across the street from the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: travel4funalways
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to Vegas to see some shows and let's be real: all anyone needs in Vegas is a bed to crash on after partying, gambling or simply a loooooong day of shopping, eating and sightseeing. The hotel is nothing fancy but that's why it's called a Motel. The front desk staff was nice at check-in and the rooms were clean. And for $40 a night, I cannot complain. And it's accross from the MGM Grand so right where you'd want to be if not staying on the strip. Great place to save money but still get a clean bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing nice about it, but no complaints either.”
Reviews.Author: travelandread
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of place you have to judge it for what it is - a cheap motel. There is nothing nice or appealing about this place, except the price tag, but we didnt have the sort of experience that turned us off either. I booked this place as a stopover hotel, arriving at 11pm and planning to catch a 10am flight. I booked this place becasue I needed a place to sleep close to the airport, and it served my needs fine. The room was sanitised ok, I was a little hesitant to shower and sleep in the sheets because of stories I had heard about motels like this, but it was all ok. It was a bit of a walk to the strip, gotta walk down past hooters and the tropicana, takes about 10-15 mins to get to NYNY. A bit of a bummer was that no taxi wanted to drive there, partly because the drive way is dufficult to get into if you are coming from the strip and also because they dont usually have people needing to be picked up from there. Ask for a room closer to the front of the hotel (where the reception is) becasue it is safer there, where the security hangs out. The truckies park and hang out at the back. Other than that, if I was in the same situation, where I needed a place to sleep during a stopover, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful and No Frills”
Reviews.Author: acsfoguy
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 served as a very cheap, and very basic stay while in Vegas for a couple of days. Let's face it, for $32 a night; you don't pay much, you don't get much!! Bed, TV, bathroom & shower. That's it!! Don't expect a clock radio, coffee maker, extra pillows or blankets, iron & ironing board, fridge, microwave, etc. They also skimp on the soap and clean towels. The hotel is wired for wifi, but you need to purchase a wifi card which gives you 24 hours of service for $2.99. That isn't bad, as many higher priced hotels charge at least $10.99. I am of the opinion that in these days and times wifi should be complimentary no matter where you stay or price you pay. It is a large spread out property, in which one section is currently(Nov '08) being renovated. A few of it's pluses include it's proximity to "The Strip". You can walk to the MGM Grand, Hooters, Tropicana, New York New York, and the Excalibur. It's also close to the MGM Grand Monorail Station. Even on a hot day of 100+ degree temperature (38+ celsius) you can easily walk to many of these hotels. There is a Cocos Restaurant next door, and a convenience store on the property. A major minus is that it's literally located across the street from McCarren Airport in close proximity to the runways. Now, I am a heavy sleeper. I live in California and have slept through earthquakes. Every morning without fail, I was awaken at 0600 by loud jet noise. To be fair to the motel, my room faced Koval Lane. Those rooms get the brunt of the noise from McCarren. When I stayed there before, I had a room on the opposite side of the motel, and airport noise wasn't a problem. At least it didn't wake me up every morning. All in all, it was a clean, cheap, and very basic room. I was only in the room long enough to take a shower, sleep, wake up, and leave for the day. It's good for a short stay. Las Vegas offers many activities to occupy your time. None of which includes sitting around your motel room. At the very least you can go out and enjoy the pool!! Motel 6 is probably one of the best bargains near The Strip. It is great for budget travelers, students and young people. If you like accommodations with a certain amount of amenities; this isn't the place for you. If you go in with very few expectations,........YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not flashy, just a solid and predictable experience”
Reviews.Author: tb10003
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend this. It's just a good hotel. Why four stars? Because there are no surprises, no problems, no negatives about it. If you're looking here you're probably just looking for a place in walking distance of the Strip, to ditch your car and get some sleep. Motel 6 provides. Pluses: - friendly and courteous service. Let me pick a room. - easy to find location. Good when you have a car. - though the decor is cheesy and outdated a bit, very clean - they have a security patrol of sorts - wifi for $3 - cheaper than Strip hotels (paid $76) - brisk 10 minute walk to New York Negatives: - airport / traffic noise; helicopters were flying back and forth overhead regularly and though not facing the street there was a lot of traffic noise, sirens and honking. - some guest noise; creaking floor above and people walking by your room sound like they're in the room. - not that bad an area but some people, esp single females, would not feel comfortable walking from the Strip to the hotel late.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!!! Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TMH44444
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for our final nite's stay in Vegas, we had a timeshare the other nites. We walked in and they would not honor the prices that we saw on the website. They said we were staying in the newer section but there was nothing new about it, the steps to the upper level were lopsided. We had to take a hike just to get to the unit passing through another motels property. This place was very noisy and a DUMP!! The room only had 2 large towels and no alarm clock and no hairdryer. The only thing it had was tiny bar of soap. I was almost afraid to sleep on the bed. The sheets did not look that clean to me. The only good thing I can say is that we only had to spend ~5 hours there before it was time to catch our plane. At $60 for a Sunday I didn't think it was a deal at all.

Reviews.Title: “For the budget traveller only.”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler79
Reviews.Content: This motel is perfect if you don't care were you stay, as long as its cheap and safe. I would consider this Motel 6 the best motel in Vegas. But that isn't saying much, you should see some of the motels in vegas. Motel 6 provides a decent place to stay, for a decent price. Its pet friendly, and perfect if you're a student, young, and preferably a male. There is no gambling on this site, and the cleanliness is inconsistant. Somtimes you win, sometimes you lose. The staff is friendly, and the rooms are what you would expect from a motel 6. The location is great, on tropicana, and inbetween the airport and the strip. There is a good pool to relax in, and a mini mart on site for all your needs. A small restaurant that serves meals too. Consider this place if you "don't care were you stay". But if you're intimidated by motels... don't risk it, its just like all the others. Go to a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: AJL8
Reviews.Content: Obviously not the best hotel in Vegas but I found it to be good value. A short walk from the strip, a couple of shops nearby and a good value cafe on the way to the strip. No coffee making facilities but free coffee from the shop in the mornings. It is a very large hotel and very spread out so you may end up some way from reception but there is parking throughout so no problem. I happen to be an aircraft enthusiast so had asked for a room with an airport view and got just that from the helpful receptionist (not sure if all of them would have been as good!).

Reviews.Title: “decent off strip basic budget accomodation for vegas”
Reviews.Author: traumatizer
Reviews.Content: We knew exactly what we wanted in vegas, cheap and clean accomodation. We werent bothered about staying at one of the flagship hotels on the strip, as we were in vegas at the beginning of a 3 week western us tour, so were economising. This motel 6 was clean, and not as noisy as you may expect being close to the airport. It had a nice big pool, not that we used it, and ice was easily accessible from a machine. The aircon worked good. Free coffee before 11am from the on site mini mart is included. The strip is about a 400 yard walk away (or take bus 192) All in all a decent budget stay in vegas for 5 nights!

Reviews.Title: “what a hole!”
Reviews.Author: micki_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first few nights in Vegas at a different place, and then moved to Motel 6 for the final 2 nights of our visit. I've never had a bad stay at a Motel 6. Not looking for the Taj Mahal, just a quiet clean bed to sleep in. At check-in, we had a hard time speaking to the desk clerk who spoke really heavily accented English and didn't seem to care about anything but getting back to his personal conversation with his co-worker. We were shoved in the very back building where all the big rigs park. The room smelled heavily of smoke, we had to leave the door open. Even my husband who smokes couldn't stand the smell. The carpet was filthy and burned. I went into the restroom and my first step in found a sticky spot of ???? on the floor. GROSS!!!!! The wall where the doorknob touches inside the bathroom was black from people's dirty hands on the doorknob that then touched the wall when the door opened and there was a big black greasy handprint on the shower curtain where someone with greasy hands had pulled the curtain shut. At least they took a shower, I guess. The first morning we were awakend repeatedly between 4 and 6 am by the trucks starting and the dreaded back up beepers. The second night, some security guard with big heavy boots started pounding on the door next to ours. I think I gathered the lady next door might have left a dog in her car? Couldn't quite make out the fuss, with his radio squawking and him loudly talking to her and her talking to him. By the time I got back to sleep, it was time for the trucks to leave again. All in all, the worst stay I've ever had anywhere in my life, but I must say, it made me appreciate going home all that much more.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money ever”
Reviews.Author: lynn.gilmour
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas as a side trip for 24 hours, must have picked the worst time to go as available accommodation was virtually non existent and that that was available had put their prices up to a ridiculous level, came across this motel and booked it in desperation, they had not put up their prices as others had, the cost between 3 of us was £11 each so did not expect much, however the room was great value, clean, nice towels, air conditioning, great shower, now bearing in mind we managed to catch only 4 hours sleep (well we were in Vegas) we could not have asked for anything better, by the time we arrived they were turning people away at the door, must have got in just in time. Come on those who have complained, taking everything into account this place is really good. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: antonthegreat17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Motel 6 - Tropicana for 4 nights in mid-March 2008. My smaller conference coincided with a VERY large one of construction workers, so most other rooms were pricy beyond belief. Motel 6 charged me $55 on weeknights and $89 on weekend nights. The lobby is very clean, does not have slot machines (which could attract an unsavory crowd). The Room was VERY clean, bed very comfortable. Good bed, good, clean, sturdy furniture. I did not use the two swiming pools but they looked clean and attractive. Wi-Fi internet is not free, but has a flat fee for 24 hours, and the connection is good. The location is also very good for the price since it is a very short walk to the strip and even shorter to the main entrance of the MGM casino (with the monorail). The good thing is that even at 3 am, the streets have people and cars on them so you are never really alone when walking around. Some bums, some drunks are about as well, but they are pretty quiet. Potential problems: no irons (but can be rented from nearby convenience store), and no ironing boards (I used the desk!). No drawers - all storage is on shelves. No toiletries except small, but nice, bars of soap. All things considered, an excellent place to stay. The price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: from_cal
Reviews.Content: The lobby definitely gave a misleading impression. It was clean, even had computers to print boarding passes. But once in the room it was all downhill! I went to wash my hands and the water came out yellow/brown! It just felt dirty in there. And it took fifteen minutes for warm water. I would never stay in a motel 6 again. On the bright side, the housekeeping was friendly and it was close to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad location”
Reviews.Author: Russnot
Reviews.Content: Booked this for the last night of my holiday as near to the airport. Perfectly adequate standard motel accommodation. Only a 10 minute walk along Tropicana Boulevard to Hooters, the Tropicana and then Excalibur, New York-New York and the monorail to everywhere else. The only problem is that the 2 storey motel is spread over a large area and is open to anyone walking in off the street. I was on the first floor and couldn't find an elevator so had to drag my suitcase up the stairs. No iron/board in the room so had to go with the crumpled look. I have no evidence that there is a problem with security but it FELT unsafe. There were quite a few people just hanging around outside the rooms and on the balconies which just gave it a rather uncomfortable atmosphere. Still, nothing did happen so it could just be me. Would probably stay elsewhere though in future.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 Las Vegas Tropicana super”
Reviews.Author: chachany
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Motel 6 Tropicana in las Vegas and it was great, really cheap, great professional service and located so close to the strip. security , us two girls felt really safe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Great room and location!!”
Reviews.Author: ryan2412
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience of motel 6 and i have to say i was impressed. The motel is in a fantastic location, two seconds from hooters (its next door) and across the road from the mgm grand. Its also easy to get there if your traveling by car, two minutes from the nearest highway. Our second floor room was clean and comfortable. One thing I was impressed with was that your minutes from the main strip, but it was reasonably quiet and secure. There is security guards walking round the premises 24 hours a day. Its a busy motel 6 so check in was quick and effecient, although the staff arent the friendliest!! Overall if your travelling on a budget, or are just looking for a cheap place near to all the action, motel 6 is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Obnoxious Staff,Bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: cactusAlberta
Reviews.Content: Great location across from MGM Grand, Great price $44 per nite. Basic room 1 queen bed,1 table,19" TV. Housekeeping was terrible. Left room dirtier than when they came in. Left dirty towels etc. Open garbage and roaches throughout the exterior of the property. Very Very unfriendly rude staff,each and everyone one of them. Can only recommend on location & price for Vegas,but,don't expect anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg3869
Reviews.Content: I found a pubic hair in the shower and a cockroach crawling around the bathroom floor. I contacted both the front desk and the hotel relations online to report the incident, expecting some kind of compensation for my bad experience, but all I was assured is that the hotel staff would spray the room for cockroaches. Based on this experience, I will never stay at a Motel 6 again, especially considering that this one star, roach-infested motel costs a minimum of $60 with tax on a Thursday night, and I paid only $80 with tax for an awesome room at the four star Hilton Las Vegas on a Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Motel”
Reviews.Author: DAB001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, clean rooms, helpful staff and right around the corner from The Strip (opposite MGM). We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of our holiday and then ended our journey with a further 2 nights (June 07) . Why pay extravagant hotel prices when Motel 6 is around $45-70 (depending on which nights you stay). It is a five minute walk to the strip and is easily accessible from the airport too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value motel”
Reviews.Author: Trina_P
Reviews.Content: We were forced to leave Circus Circus(CC) in the middle of our trip due to their mistake and I was not going to pay $189/night there! At my mother in law's suggestion, we called Motel 6 and they were able to get us a handicap accessible room with one bed and it had a roll in shower for $59/night. I was thrilled yet apprehensive. We had to leave CC by 11:00 am and the check in time was 3pm at Motel 6. We had to sit in the lobby for 3 hours. They said the room was not ready and we could not check in. We asked if that room could be cleaned sooner since we were in the lobby waiting rather than a room with no one waiting on, but they said no. That did not make sense cleaning a room which was not even rented yet and making guests who have already paid wait 3 hours! Once we did get into the room, we were pleased at its cleanliness right off. The room was basic with a TV, one bed, desk, chair soap, towels and wash cloths. As far as accessibility went, it was more than adequate with room to move around, everything within reach and set up perfectly for wheelchair users. While the motel is not directly on the strip, it was no issue getting to the strip. In fact we went straight out our door to the outside, rather than having to go down an elevator, wind around through a crowded lobby and out the door. This actually made up for the distance being a bit farther to the strip. The small cafe next door has very good food. We ate breakfast there both mornings. Good food as well as good service at a reasonable price. I would highly recommend this motel to anyone who wants to save their money for what they come to Vegas for and that is usually for fun! It is perfect for wheelchair users as stated before. Families would get a good bargain hotel and a pool for the kids. Resist the temptation of the higher priced hotels on the Strip and stay here. Unless you just have to have the luxuries and plan on spending a lot of time in your hotel room while in Vegas, this is perfect for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great basic budget motel near the strip”
Reviews.Author: 2ez4me
Reviews.Content: Our room had 2 full sized beds, a large bathroom, nice cold AC, carpet was clean and the room looked like it had been recently renovated. We all were pleasantly surprised. There's even a decent pool area. The motel is about 1/2 mile from the strip. If you're really lazy, the Hooters Casino is right next door, with some decent gambling and a nice pool. As previously posted, the area's a little rough and there may be a few strange folks walking around, but we never felt unsafe. Sat ($80) and Sun ($50) w/tax = $140 for 2 nights, for 2 couples. All the hotels on the strip were $200 plus for the weekend we went so Motel 6 was a steal. If you can handle a short walk to get to the strip, and go without all the luxuries of the big casino hotels, then you'll get a really good deal at this motel. I'm giving it 4 stars based on value you get for the money. Make your reservations online to get a really good online rate. You can cancel up to 6pm the day of arrival.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a cheap place”
Reviews.Author: Narrowgauge
Reviews.Content: If you're reading this, you're probably looking for a cheap place and wonder whether this one is sanitary, comfortable and safe enough. It is. Typical of the thin-towel category of hotels, my room was cheaply furnished but comfortable enough and clean. There are no "amenities" of any kind: no tub, only a shower; no shampoo, tissues, radio, clock, coffee maker, iron. They're even stingy with the soap; I was going to leave a note asking for more soap, but they don't provide a pen or paper, either. No high speed internet, but you can use free local calls for dial up. There's a table and two chairs. The TV and air conditioner worked OK. The bed was OK. It's kind of a seedy area but I never felt unsafe. BTW, the $4.99 breakfast special next door at Coco's is OK. Coffee is $2 extra, but they gave me refils and let me take a large cup with me to drink on the road. The decaf wasn't very good, but like the room, it was cheap. If you head east on Tropicana for a mile or two and turn right into a strip mall called University Plaza, the family run "King and I" restaurant serves a good Thai curry for $9.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - not luxury, but fine for a crash pad.”
Reviews.Author: BrendaMurray
Reviews.Content: Motel 6 is basic - no clock, shampoo. Basic needs - a towel, some soap. Has a TV and my room (416, east wing) appeared pretty recently renovated. I had a nonsmoking room which had an ashtray (go figure, an ashtray but no pen) - and kind of stunk of stale smoke. For $40 in Vegas, you are getting a VERY good deal with Motel 6 - its within walking distance of the strip. Other "value" properties around town are $40-50 - include places you DO NOT WANT TO GO TO. (Trust me, I'm local.) Good shower, clean bed, decent carpet - For value, I'd recommend it to guests. The ladies were really nice at check in. The downsides: Folks in transient mode - bunches of temp workers renting one room and having the whole gang use it for the shower; working girls; motel setting. I felt perfectly safe, however. it can be loud - motels often are - all the activity outside. So this place is perfect for a bed and a shower - not for luxuriating in spa-style.

Reviews.Title: “o.k.”
Reviews.Author: Jean-bobHillywood
Reviews.Content: my wife and I are from holland, and one thing we forgotten , never ever visit vegas in a weekend !! first double room rates 2nd no vacancy ! a nice lady at motel 6 in vegas offered us a "bad" room with dirty carpet fot 1/2 room rate ! i can appricited that ! excuse me fot the bad english

Reviews.Title: “The Place to stay if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: oorfenegro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during the CES, the biggest convention in the United States. During big conventions like CES, the strip hotels have no problem charging $300 a night or more for a room that shouldn't go for more than $100 max. My room was $40 a night; it was clean, comfortable and across the street from the MGM Grand. If you need to get somewhere, the Monorail station is right across the street. I have a old Sony laptop, and I left it in the room every night of my stay with no problem. My only complaint was the heater, which is set on a timer. I would have been nice to have consistant heat, especially on those cold desert nights. Two other good reasons to stay at Motel 6. They don't put an hold on your credit card or charge for local phone calls. Most other hotels charge you to look at a phone and you will also charge you to hook up to the high speed internet. Motel 6 lets you make all the local calls you want, which means you can hook up to the internet for unlimited access at 56K if you have a dial up account, which is fine to check email, the weather, the hometown newspaper website or flight info. If you're trying to save some bucks and all you need is a place to sleep and shower, you csan't beat Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: vautour2121
Reviews.Content: For people knowing what is a Motel 6, this place is your's. 5 minutes walk to MGM hotel and strip. Free Coffee between 7-11 a.m at the mini-mart, (just beside hotel). Room not very large but it's clean, and you park the car just front. 42 $ for 2 during week was o.k for us. Room #337 (second floor) east building with west view was very good deal. Taxi from airport to hotel = 13$ but driver charge 1$ each luggage, if not = 10$ Breakfast at coco's restaurant is so so. For 2-3$ more try the Luxor buffet. In some occasions you can pay about 60$ on a strip, i think at this price you can go but go to Motel 6 if hotel on Strip exceed 100$. Hope you will understand my english beacause i'm a french canadian

Reviews.Title: “what do you want for your money”
Reviews.Author: roaminfred
Reviews.Content: FROM the UK and use this motel each time i come over, since my philosphy in life is why spend your money ,when you dont have too, its clean, handy for the strip, and good to get to and from the airport, always clean, and staff are helpfull, i know its a bit dark at night, but i havnt had any trouble, and the free cup of coffee in the morning is welcome with the fresh doughnut thats not free, enjoy life, enjoy vegas, and save your money to spend on other things

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough for a motel”
Reviews.Author: Janiedoesdallas
Reviews.Content: OK, firstly it's a motel so you're not going to get all the same comforts that you might in a hotel. The rooms are basic, ours had two queen beds, TV with cable, bathroom with shower and enough space for suitcases etc. The motel is VERY big. From the road, the office is at the front. Directly behind this is the pool area which is very pleasant, large pool with loads of sun loungers. The rooms spread back in a row from this point and this goes back around a quarter of a mile. This is the East Wing Then, to the right as you look at it, there's a small convenience store and a cheapish restaurant. Behind this is a Best Western motel and to the right of that, more Motel 6 rooms; this is the West Wing. You have to cross the Best Western car park to get to the from the West Wing to the East Wing where the office, laundry and vending machines are. It's a couple of minutes walk. There is a smaller pool in the West Wing but it's right near the car park and only separated by some railings which you could see right through. There didn't seem to be anyone using it whilst I was there. We asked to be near the East Wing pool but were told it was full. These rooms seem to be the most popular and I don't think you'll get one if arriving after 2pm or on a weekend (like we did). As it was weekend, the motel was very busy and yes, some of the other guests looked a bit dodgy. I heard a group of young men talking about "working some b*****s", which I took to mean they were pimps. There was always at least one man hanging around the car park, waiting for his lady to finish work (if you know what I mean). That said, they never bothered us and I did NOT feel in any danger. I suppose they're just going about their business and don't want any hassle either. But, hey, this is Vegas, that kind of thing goes on everywhere so I don't suppose I should be shocked. They're probably more discrete in fancier hotels. There were security guards riding around in golf carts and bicycles all day and night too.
