They didn't look too tough but it was reassuring to see them keeping an eye on everyone's rooms and cars. GOOD POINTS: The location. It's 5 minutes by car from the strip. If you have a car, take my advice, go down Koval road rather than the strip - we sat in traffic for over an hour and only got as far as Paris Hotel. The rooms were clean (the bath looked a little worn but certainly not dirty) and attended to every day. We were about halfway down the West Wing (room 1127) and had no problems with noise from other guests. Durning the week it's very quet and you should have no difficulty parking right outside your room. It's cheap BAD POINTS: It's right under the flight path for helicopters and during the day, they go over frequently. Anything from every 30 minutes to about 6 per minute at times. This was not a problem at night though. It's too big - you can't just nip out got ice in your PJs because you have to walk over Best Western's car park to get to it. They could do with bigger laundry facilities. I was travelling around the west of the USA and had 6 weeks' worth of clothing. They have 2 machines and 2 dryers. This is just not enough for a large motel. In conclusion, this motel is fine for the money. It's clean, the staff are OK, the location is good (especially if you drive) and it's cheap. More money for you to lose in the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “good for 1 day /night”
Reviews.Author: nikkkichic
Reviews.Content: me & my parents stayed here 1 night for the start of a 10 day trip to bryce canyon -lake powell-grand canyon etc. I thought it was a good place to stay it was close to all of las vegas strip & there was a great place right in front of motel 6 called cocos it was a diner type of eaterywent there for breakfast & dinner went there often. only thing I did not like was the noise from the Planes & Helicopters flying around( close to airport ).

Reviews.Title: “small and cosey!”
Reviews.Author: princessvixen
Reviews.Content: well i expected the worst as i'd heard a lot about this hotel so i wasnt expecting much.the rooms are very small.we had a double and there's very little room.The shower had silverfish in it and the chairs were old and needed replacing.the air con was fine and the pool was cold.for the price its ok but if you have the money stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A hot place”
Reviews.Author: Caprifischer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Motel 6 for one night in June 2006 (for about 80$ the double for one night). It's Motel 6 -so you know, what to expect. The Motel itself is in good shape, clean and really located near a couple of interesting Las Vegas attractions. It is a decent place to stay, unless vou are from Europe and not used to sleep with a noisy, chilly airconditioning, running next to your bed. It was 43 degrees Celsius (125 Fahrenheit) outside and without the airconditioning you virtually grilled in your room. So, Europeans, beware in the summertime. An acceptable place for the cooler part of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for One Night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This motel was only 2 blocks from the south end of the strip. It was ok for one night but the swimming pool that we were suppose to use was locked with no explanation as to why and with 115 degree heat it would have been nice to use it!

Reviews.Title: “Good, safe and clean for less money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week at the begin of May, 2006, we made a reservation from the internet, 53 dollar per night. It's almost 3 blocks from the Strip, you can eat your breakfast at Coco's a restaurant nearby the motel, for 10 dollars you have a good breakfast for 2!! The rooms are clean, safe, there's a nice swimmingpool where you can lay back at your chair! there are enough of them....if we want to go back to Vegas, we are going back to this Motel...

Reviews.Title: “great bargain”
Reviews.Author: chooseaname
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here one night for $60. Excellent price, very clean. Two blocks from strip. Less than 5 minutes from the airport. AND, we got in on a Wednesday night without reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: dikthompson
Reviews.Content: The biggest motel 6 in the franchise but the same as any other 6. Even though its 2 blocks off the strip you will be walking alot to get places. The 2 blocks seems more like 5 blocks somehow, and once you go 5 blocks youl still have a lot of walking to do depending on were your going. There is plenty of parking however and you could drive were you want to go and not walk at all. Thats one thing I like about Vegas, lots of free parking. But I prefer to find a base were I can walk anywhere. The avenue is safe as could be for a city, a big plus, the reviewer who was nervous on it alone could be afraid of his own shadow.. The pool might come in handy, Vegas can be hot. But be careful, the desert sun can be hardcore on the skin. Clean and safe room but I would try to find something on the strip for more $$$$$. If you cant than the 6 is very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “1 block to the strip for cheap!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to see Dane Cook at the Mandalay Bay and everything was excellent. Obviously it is a budget motel so all you get is beds, a TV, a sink, toilet and shower. But that was all I expected and needed! The room was very clean, I had no problems with perfumes or anything. In addition, the A/C unit was very efficient and reletivly quiet, The shower head was a great wide, plastic shower spray type. My only problem, (and its a tiny one) is that if you stay in the west wing, you have to pass through the Best Value, and the parking lots are kind of hard to find, but once you do, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly but friendly”
Reviews.Author: NadineMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was the first real 'budget' hotel we almost stayed at. The rooms are heavily perfumed with air freshener. My partner is extremely sensitive to odors and so we couldn't stay. (nb: i didn't want to stay because of this and I'm not 'sensitive') The staff checked the room to ensure we hadn't used the facilities, or damaged the room in any way, we checked another room, but the smell was as strong. The front desk then agreed to reimburse our payment and we moved on to the MGM Grand. (see for details)

Reviews.Title: “Handy Budget Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being on a budget "Road trip" around Las Vegas and S.F., I selected this motel as both nights were during a weekend (Where the Hotel strip prices more than double). We stayed two separate nights (One returning from the Grand Canyon, the other from the San Francisco leg of our tour).This is a big Motel complex. It's very handy being next to the airport (The odd thing being - you didn't hear the planes at night. However - There was a fair bit of road noise from Tropicana Av. - but you must bare in mind how busy L.V. actually is !!). The rooms were basic - clean and tidy. Great for our needs - a bed and shower. As previous reviews indicate - the sort walk to the strip was not a problem. There is quite a large Diner on site called "Coco's" for breakfast. (A small hint - even though the Motel is right next to the airport - don't bother getting a rip-off cab - use one of the "Shuttles" which are currently fixed at $5 each. It cost nearly $9 just to travel between the Airport Entrance and the Departures/Arrivals Terminal!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: happy_families_8
Reviews.Content: Very good; typical Motel 6 two Queen size beds, ideal for family of 2 Adults 2 kids. Next to airport, lots of helicopters around in the day time; didn't have any noise problems at night. The best thing was the location. Within 5 minutes walk of the MGM Grand and Monorail, couldn't be much closer to the strip; no need for cabs. Secure pool. Room rate was under $50. A nice diner on site, and a small supermarket - 3 T Shirts for $10. All in all, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: chiachiang
Reviews.Content: Although it wasn`t located on the strip, we had no complaints walking the 100-200 metres to the nearest hotel (MGM Grand) on the strip. The room is clean and try to get a room close to the front desk if you don`t drive. Great for people who need only a bed and shower in Las Vegas. Get a good rate even on fridays when hotel rates doubled in the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever stay in a motel, and I was very pleased. I usually stay at one of the nicer hotels on the strip, but this time it was extremely expensive, so my friend recomended Motel 6. This motel is very clean. The rooms are small, but overall good for the Vegas lifestyle. We only used the room for sleeping, but there was a pool available as well. The only things is that there is no shampoo or conditioner, you may need to bring you own. Have fun.. Its only a 3 min walk to the new monorail behind the MGM. Oh, and try to get a room on the West wing.. You'll have a nice view of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: payitforward2u
Reviews.Content: Great location, directly across the street from the MGM and the Monorail which will take you to all the major casinos on the strip. Don’t expect luxury, just value, and try to get a room facing away from the airport to reduce the noise from jets taking off at night. You can spend the money you save on gambling, shows, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value”
Reviews.Author: David_Avery
Reviews.Content: The motel is literally around the corner from the MGM Grand and therefore so close to the Strip. It offers excellent value for money. I paid $38 per night. The rooms are large enough and come with AC. I cannot recommend this budget accomodation enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad ... It's a Motel 6!”
Reviews.Author: SFcatamount
Reviews.Content: This place is not as bad as some of the reviews would suggest. Yes, the rooms are small, but I found them to be typical of a budget motel. After reading the reviews, I was expecting something the size of a cruise ship's lower deck! But instead, it's just your average room with two doubles beds, a small desk/dresser combo, a TV, a nightstand, and not really much room for anything else. Not being a person who spends much time in the room except for sleeping, this suited me just fine. We had a room on the west wing (closest to the strip) and found the accomodations very clean and well kept. Housekeeping service was quick and efficient in keeping things tidy during our three-day stay there. One word of warning ... bring your own shampoo and lotion, because they don't provide the little bottles in the bathroom (only soap). If you have to buy these things in the quik-mart next door, they'll charge you an arm and a leg. For some reason, the shower felt like it was putting out carbonated water, with as much air as water, so it was not a place you'd want to linger ... but it was clean as well. The location is okay. It's a short walk to the MGM Grand across the street, but some of the darker corners of this large property are a little sketchy at night. We did see security officers in the parking lot at various times, which goes a long way in making you feel safer, and never encountered any problems. We always saw several tourists like ourselves making the same walk, no matter what time of the day or night. The Hotel San Remo is at the next block over, and if you like this location, you may also want to check into prices at America's Best Value Inn, which oddly is situated right in-between the two wings of Motel 6 and looks like the same level of accomodations. The Carrow's/Coco's restaurant on site was convenient and decent for breakfast, but like many places near the strip, was overpriced for what you got. If you book this place, just remember it's a "budget" motel ... no shampoo, shoe polish, or even Kleenex are supplied here ... but it's not a "ghetto" motel by any means!

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Las Vegas - Tropicana
HotelInfo.Address: 195 East Tropicana Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89109
